title: Persistent Lag Issues
body:
Hello all!

I get random, sever packet loss issues playing League over wifi. I have tried three different routers and three different WiFi cards, and two different modems; the problem is definitely isolated to just over wifi (fine over Ethernet), and, I believe, just to my computer. What's up?

(For the record, Riot support has been very helpful, and last we spoke was when we thought I might either have a bad wifi card or a burned out pcie slot. As you'll see, since I've replaced the motherboard and wifi card since then, it ain't that).

More detail: I have done all the port forwarding, etc., that you might expect, but it has not helped in the least. I get the problem on my computer in a variety of games now (basically, also in Overwatch).

I have tried three different Verizon routers (and corresponding ethernet cables) and two different Modems, and all with the same problem. I have additionally (coincidentally--I'm not pouring money into this) upgraded my computer's motherboard, wifi card, ram, and CPU while this problem was ongoing. Tests before those upgrades and after them are still the same.

Since ethernet tests go great, the problem must be with the router or with the connection between the router and the modem. Having replaced all of them, it seems difficult for me to believe that they ALL had some defect. It seems to me either:

    My computer is sending data over wifi to my router which confuses it.
    Verizon G1100 (Quantum Gateway, or whatever silly name it has) routers just blow at video games and somehow just started sucking within the last month, having been perfect up till then.

For the record, I do all these tests with no other programs, hidden or otherwise, running. So it's not that issue. Also, my harddrives appear to be stable.

Cheers buds, I appreciate the help.

replies.body:
Since you've done so much troubleshooting on your own already, I'd like to first see if I can get a clear picture of what your lag/packet loss looks like. If you could grab [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) and run a traceroute, I'll be able to see where the connection issues are starting. When you load up the program, use 104.160.131.1 as the host and let it run. 

When it's done, grab that data or take a screenshot and shoot it my way!

After looking over your traceroute, it seems that your high ping is beginning at your network router. The first line 

- | FIOS_Quantum_Gateway.fios-router.home - 0 | 414 | 414 | 0 | 107 | 469 | 233 |

shows that you're getting a high ping of 469 before your connection ever leaves your home network. 

With that being the case, I'd like to see if you're getting the same results on our NA server 104.160.131.1, as your ping might be different when using the correct servers.

Well, I didn't have nearly as bad lag in that game (I've gotten pretty good at playing through this lag) and my winmtr was this:

|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|                                      WinMTR statistics                                   |
|                       Host              -   %  | Sent | Recv | Best | Avrg | Wrst | Last |
|------------------------------------------------|------|------|------|------|------|------|
|   FIOS_Quantum_Gateway.fios-router.home -    0 |  633 |  633 |    0 |    1 |  226 |    1 |
|lo0-100.NYCMNY-VFTTP-343.verizon-gni.net -    0 |  633 |  633 |    0 |    4 |  240 |    3 |
|     B3343.NYCMNY-LCR-21.verizon-gni.net -    0 |  633 |  633 |    2 |    6 |  240 |    5 |
|                   No response from host -  100 |  126 |    0 |    0 |    0 |    0 |    0 |
|              0.ae11.GW14.NYC1.ALTER.NET -    0 |  633 |  633 |    2 |    5 |  241 |    3 |
|                           204.148.68.38 -    0 |  633 |  633 |    3 |    6 |  250 |    4 |
|                          104.160.132.35 -    0 |  633 |  633 |    2 |    5 |  242 |    4 |
|          ae31-br01.chi01.riotdirect.net -    0 |  633 |  633 |   18 |   20 |  249 |   20 |
|                           104.160.131.1 -    0 |  633 |  633 |   18 |   21 |  253 |   22 |
|________________________________________________|______|______|______|______|______|______|
   WinMTR v0.92 GPL V2 by Appnor MSP - Fully Managed Hosting & Cloud Provider

For the record, the lag that I've encountered is a little weird. My upstream doens't appear affected at all. Like if during this lags, which i get rubberbanded all over the place, inputted commands still hit hte server in the normal time. I don't see them, but having done things like Q hop over the wall as kindred, I'll eventually snap back to being in the place I thought I was sending myself.

Heeeeey you're pretty dang good if you can anticipate lag and still q hop walls with kindred XD!

All joking aside, it looks like pinging to the server 104.160.131.1 gave a different story! Your connection is still starting off pretty high(226) before it ever leaves your home network though =\ . Since your connection is pretty stable when using an ethernet cable, this might just be your best bet while playing. 

With this seeming like a very specific issue, I'd like for you to get some one on one help from our tech guys. Shoot them a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) with your latest traceroute, and they'll be able to give much more context as to what could be the root of the problem.
Cheers bud; I'll try the live chat when I get home from work
Been having this same exact problem since February. Can't log online and play a game without getting attacked by lag spikes. what do
